main.title: Fino
main.description: A digital tool to prevent food waste in restaurants

intro.title: Fino - A digital tool to prevent food waste in restaurants
intro.description:
Food waste is a common problem in restaurants around the world. During my undergraduate studies I worked as a cook in restaurants in Germany and the US. Despite careful planning, we often had to throw away edible food at the end of the night.

For my master thesis at the Queensland University of Technology, I collaborated with chefs in Brisbane and Melbourne to find solutions for food waste in the restaurant industry. The result is Fino, a digital tool that simplifies the procurement process.

main.title: Festival für unangepasste Kunst
main.description: Experience these highly addictive potato chips

intro.title: An unadjusted festival for unadjusted art
intro.description:
The Festival für Unangepasste Kunst (unadjusted art) is a yearly event in Munich showcasing your not so normal artists. The festival is hosted by german trash art artist ADLER A.F. together with Jessica Petraccaro-Goertsches and several other LMU employees.

During a design workshop at LMU we had the chance to create a mobile application that accompanies the festival. The app containes information about the three weekends covering the topics democracy, power, and participation.

While designing and building the app, we tried to capture the unadjusted atmosphere of the festival and its artists.

main.title: WeSprout
main.description: An urban farming community for Lagos and Munich

intro.title: WeSprout
intro.description: WeSprout is a concept to explore how hydroponics - growing leafy greens and vegetables in water instead of soil - could be made available to people in low-income areas in Lagos, Nigeria. We developed WeSprout as part of the EIT Food Summer School on Sustainable Food Systems that took place in Haifa, Israel and Munich, Germany in September 2019.

main.title: Buntes Deutschland
main.description: Battle the rise of right wing populism with colorful stickers

intro.title: Buntes Deutschland
intro.description:
Since the fall of 2015 when Germany took in thousands of refugees seeking protection against war, persecution, and torture, right wing populist are on the rise. The likes of Pegida and AfD use the tense situation to agitate against refugees, free media, and liberals in Germany.

Buntes Deutschland (Colorful Germany) is my response to right wing populism and the open display of xenophobia. Like-minded people can use the Buntes Deutschland stickers to set an example for a open, free, and colorful Germany.

intro.title: Social Ride - A bike for everyone
intro.description:
SocialRide is the project of a group of friends, giving out free bycicles and repairs to refugees and people in need. For us as students, the bike is an essential but affordable means of transportation. That's why we think, the bike is the perfect vehicle for incoming refugees to explore beautiful Munich.

Since October 2014 we setup our mobile repair workshop in refugee homes across Munich. What started as a student project, turned into monthly workshops and collaborations with organizations from Munich and all over Germany.

Creating and monitoring the website for SocialRide is both challenging and rewarding. I can use the skills learned at the LMU to help refugees get a head start here in Munich. Most importantly I can work with a great team on hip bicycles.

main.title: TIM One of a kind
main.description: A modern, lightweight project automation platform

intro.title: TIM - a lightweight project automation platform
intro.description:
TIM Solutions, a small software company in the outskirts of Munich, is the first step of my professional career in Germany. After completing my Bachelor's in the spring of 2015, I started as an intern, developing the new user interface of the web-based process automation tool TIM.

We started the project TIM One of a kind by analyzing the existing user interface of TIM. By asking our customers, we realized what works well and what needs to be adjusted.

With a user-centered approach we made sure to  design a modern, lightweight application that puts the user first.
